>
>Understood. Do you see why I don't say "unit test"? :)

Yes, but even managers have heard of unit testing. I can see it now ....

PROGRAMMER: "Hey boss, I want to write some programmer tests."
MANAGER: "Not on my watch. Now sit down and get back to your unit testing!"

>I don't know that there is a definitive source that I would
>care to use.
>You might wish to ask this question on a group like
>software-testing or
>agile-testing.

Funny you should mention that ... the good folks at comp.software.testing have an FAQ that provides fairly decent definitions for most of this stuff.

http://www.faqs.org/faqs/software-eng/testing-faq/

Whether management will accept this as a definitive source of definitions is another question.

Simon
